summary: REQ-26 and REQ-28 appear implemented via a reusable frontend error-state component (with raw/copyable error details and Retry) plus authorization-aware error parsing that explicitly instructs admins to use the `caffeineAdminToken` parameter. REQ-27 (backend hardening for empty `caffeineAdminToken` during access-control initialization) is not evidenced in the provided backend diff snippet, so it cannot be verified as implemented.

missing_requirements.requirement: Ensure backend access-control initialization does not trap/break authenticated usage when `caffeineAdminToken` is missing/empty; calling initialization with empty string must succeed and normal authenticated flows must continue to work; valid token behavior unchanged.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff summary shows many backend authorization checks and state initialization, but does not show any change to the access-control initialization entrypoint/logic that handles an empty admin token (nor any guarding against traps on empty input). With the backend file truncated, there is insufficient evidence that the empty-secret path was hardened.

hallucinated_features.description: Non-English/emoji user-facing text in the error UI ("ðŸ’¡ How to fix this:").
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest constraint requires all user-facing text be in English; including an emoji violates the strictness of that constraint even though the surrounding text is English.
